au.edu.uts.eng.remotelabs.rigclient.rig.primitive
Interface IPrimitiveController

All Known Implementing Classes:
DerivedMockController, MasterOnlyAclController, au.edu.uts.eng.remotelabs.rigclient.rig.primitive.tests.MockController, WindowsNewUserController
public interface IPrimitiveController

Interface for primitive controller classes. Primitive control classes must extend this class and provide public methods which may be requested as 'actions'. The declaration of these methods must have the following signature:
    public PrimitiveResponse nameAction(PrimitiveRequest)
Where 'name' is what is requested as the action parameter of a primitive control request. If the actions do not follow this signature, then routing to them will fail. Action methods may be either instance or static methods.
The following methods should be implemented in controller classes in addition to action methods:

  • initController - Method that is called during instantiation of the controller.
  • preRoute - Method that is called before routing to an action of this class.
  • postRoute - Method that is called after the completion of the routed action.
  • cleanup - Method that is called when the controller is cleanup up (generally at the termination of sessions).
Controller classes have the following life-cycle:
  1. On first request of a controller instance action method, the controller is instantiated and added to the controller cache.
  2. On the next and subsequent requests of a controller instance action method, the controller instance is recalled and reused to run action.
  3. On termination of the masters rig session, clean up is called and the controller instance is discarded.
It is safe to have resources (open files, handles...) as instance fields provided they are cleaned in the cleanup method.

Method Summary
 void cleanup()
          Cleans up the controller.
 boolean initController()
          Initialise the controller.
 boolean postRoute()
          Runs after the completion of an action method.
 boolean preRoute()
          Runs before routing of a primitive control request to an action method.
 

Method Detail

initController

boolean initController()
Initialise the controller. This method is run once at instantiation of the controller. If the return is false, the controller is discarded and the primitive control request fails. The controller instance will not be cached.

Returns:
true if successful, false otherwise

preRoute

boolean preRoute()
Runs before routing of a primitive control request to an action method. If the return is false, the primitive control request fails and the cached controller is discarded.

Returns:
true if successful, false otherwise

postRoute

boolean postRoute()
Runs after the completion of an action method. If the return is false, the cached controlled is discarded.

Returns:
true if successful, false otherwise

cleanup

void cleanup()
Cleans up the controller. This is run when the cached controller instance is discarded.
